Comment:
I feel guilty when when I realize that I consider material things  
more important than caring for my relatives.  I feel very  
self-centered.
When I found a bristle in the liver paste tube.

When I was tired and unmotivated, I shouted at my girlfriend and  
and brought up negative sides of her character which are actually  
not so important.
When one has neglected or been unjust to a good friend.

When I climbed up a tree to pick apples.  The angle of the ladder  
I was on did not enable me to get high enough.  This implied  
that the ladder was not very stable.

When I see children on T.V from areas devastated by drought and  
war.
When I nearly walked on a blindworm and then saw it crawl away.
When, as an adult I have been caught lying or behaving badly.
When one lets friends down

A bus drove over my right leg.  The event itself was not very  
frightening but when I had to wait in the emergency ward for  
three hours and then my leg began to swell, I was frightened.

At my Summer job, nobody looked after me in particular and I had  
to learn all on my own.
When I was not accepted as a student in finance and accounting.
Railway station good-bye.

I told a friend that I was going to a party and he would not  
enjoy himself if he came along.  He understood  that he would not  
have fitted in and there was something in that.
I passed an exam that I was absolutely certain that I had failed.

On the way back from Denmark with a friend on a small yatch,  
there was a storm and my friend was blown overboard;  I was very  
scared till I managed to get him back onboard.
I hapened to overhear something which I was not meant to hear.

When I am out in the dark and a suspicious looking character  
comes towards me.

On the way home one Friday night in the heavy rain the car  
acquaplanned.  I lost contact with the road surface for a few  
seconds.
A bad smelling cucumber.
I do not help out enough at home.

When I was young - 14, I pinched from a store and was caught.   
The store then contacted my parents.

When the whole family gets together for a one week holiday.   
Everybody feels free and the trip is well planned.  It works out  
well and we enjoy ourselves.
Marriage crises.  Boredom.
When I spanked a child in anger and later regretted it terribly.

When I drove to Stockholm for the first time and drove off the  
Stora Hissingen road at the wrong exit.
When a dog is left whining outside a shop.

When I promised to help a friend over a weekend and did not keep  
the promise.

When I found out that I had passed the last two exams by a  
margin of three marks.

When I found out that my father had lung cancer and they did not  
know how long he would live.

When I was stopped by plain clothes policemen because the car I  
was driving had overturned on the Avenue.  I had been driving too  
fast, and I was afraid when I was stopped, questionned and then  
toild to go.  The situation ended happily since there were no  
consequences.

A close acquaintance of the family died of lung cancer.   
Although it was expected, I still felt depressed.

I met intoxicated people with dubious intentions in a back alley  
one Wednesday night.
I experience feelings of guilt because I do not study enough.

We were starting a student project, and the teacher we talked to  
was very negative and not very helpful.
When my boyfriend openly let me down, preferring another girl.
Can't think of any.

I wandered by mistake into the safety zone of a shooting range,  
and was shot at.
Being treated unfairly.
Breaking up with a girl.
None.

I was accused of having done something, which I hadn't and got  
very angry.
When my grandmother died.

A couple of years ago during the summer holiday, I was fishing at  
a lake with my husband.  Suddenly it started raining while the  
sun was still shining. I experienced a feeling of joy, happiness  
and fulfillment.  the whole nature was full of music.

I was alone at home, in bed reading a womens' magazine in which  
there were storiees of paranormal experiences.  My leg was  
itching and I stretched my hand to scratch and I felt another  
strange hand. (later I realized that it was the corner of the  
blanket)

I heard that a former superior of mine had died, I was later at  
home home reading about it in the newspaper and I thought of our  
interaction and how it was no longer possible.  The limited scope  
of human life is sad.

In the tram there was a fat, sickly looking woman in front of me  
who was asking for directions in a thick voice.  When she got up to  
go a disgusting smell of urine came from her.  I felt that I  
would choke.

I made a remark to my sister concerning her attitude to men, the  
way she talked and I compared her to an acquaintance of mine.   
Later, the same evening, my sister looked sad.  I felt guilty  
about her sadness.

I had a summer job in Sweden, and my boyfriend came to meet me on  
my birthday.

Once I arrived two hours late to my work place (a bank) and I was  
still feeling feeble and tired.

I was told quite unexpectedly that one wanted me to become the  
vice-chairman of our student organisation.  I was really  
surprised and joy was the first emotion I felt, though behind it  
there was worry - how shall I succeed ?

Our tutorial group was soon to be divided, and we got a list of  
names of freshmen, out of which five were to be in my group.  We  
read the names and then each group went its own way to a seminar  
room.  I wondered how I would cope with the new situation and if  
I would succeed as a group leader.

We were in a disco and the evening was not at all pleasant.   
Despite my not knowing why, I was angry with my companion.  I let  
him feel my bad humour as I cannot hide my feelings.

My grandmother died, and my mother called me one sunday morning  
in the Autumn.  The way my mother told me about it, I hated her  
at that moment.  She sounded as if she had been waiting for the  
death of my grandmother.  I had lost a person close to me.  I  
felt guilty too as I had been bad to my grandmother of late.  I had not  
remained calm when she no longer understood everything so well.

At the underground station, a drunkard came to speak to me.  He  
tried to ask me something but I did not answer so he began to  
speak about me with his companion.  I detested this dirty  
growling man.

I was worried by a task related to my studies which had to be  
done in groups of two.  I was talking about it to my friends when  
I said something negative, in too abrupt a manner, concerning my  
work partner.  I did not quite mean what I said and I felt  
ashamed at having been mean enough to criticize him as he is also  
a friend of mine.

After hearing about the death of my grandfather.  First I could  
not believe it, but later I wept and felt the situation was  
hopeless.  I felt lonely and wanted to be consolated.

At my temporary job, I have to restrict  others' actions and make  
them obey me, and this very often gives me  a feeling of guilt.  I  
wish there could be some other way of acting.

After having quarelled unnecessarily and without any reason, and  
having been stupidly cross in every way.
When I won a tennis match.

Celebrations on the graduation day with the orchestra playing in  
the garden ( I am a part of this orchestra).

I had a very heavy work load and two colleagues, whom I have  
nothing against, disturbed me by "terror ringing", i.e  
continously interrupting me by telephoning.

When I overtook a car on the mainroad, misjudging the distance of  
an oncoming car and this resulted in tooting and flashing from  
the other driver (we could have collided), and I had an  
acquaintance in the car with me.
When I met an old schhol friend (school love).

When I realized that my girlfriend, whom I like, and I were going  
to separate.
When I forgot my mother's birthday.
Passed the last exam.

When I was travelling by tram, I tripped and fell against the  
door.  I thought that I was going to fall out.

I can not think of any incident when I have felt very ashamed.   
There are small incidents that I am ashamed of, for instance,  
not sending money to the children in Ethiopia.
When I saw a dog which had been knocked down by a car.
I stopped working (had a boring job).

When I am alone in a room with no contact with anyone -  
loneliness drains me.
When I was on holiday someone vomited in front of me.
When I feigned sick leave from work.
When I did not buy what I had promised to.

My 2 year old daughter disappeared in a moment of inattention; I  
was responsible for her.

A colleague asked me for some advice and as he did not have  
enough confidence in me he asked a third person.

I wanted to be pregnant and did not succeed, so I was depressed     
at every menstruation.

When I was at a party I met an old friend from an adult  
education course.  We had not met for 2 years but had both thought  
a lot about each other.  A wonderful experience.

When close relatives tried to dissuade me from studying  
Psychology because of its low status.

I had a long discussion on politics with an acquaintance.  He  
was more knowledgeable than me and I failed to explain my point  
of view and was misunderstood so I felt depressed and left.
When I recently got an appartment in central Gottenburg.

When my son returned from mountaineering - healthy in body and  
soul.

When one meets new people with whom one is forced to collaborate  
with.

The sports fishermen who catch gulls instead of fish with their hooks.  
  It is often a mistake but it makes me angry.
I felt sad and depressed when I heard that our cat had died.

When I was working as a nurse in a mental hospital, a patient ate  
up the contents of another patient's spitoon.

I arrived an hour late for an important meeting ( I had  
misunderstood the time).
When I was acceptted as a student of psychology.

When, after a week at school, a teacher sent a note home saying  
that my son was inattentive and unable to do his lessons.

When I thought that it was going to be impossible for me to start  
studying (due to wrong information from the student advisor).

When I made the same mistake that I had accused someone else of, and  
this was obvious to a third pereson.

When I nearly drowned in icy water wearing ice skates.  It was  
difficult to get out.

When I was pointed out as a problem child in primary school and  
my mother took the teacher's point of view.
When I was accused of neglecting work for the wrong reasons.

My parents attitude towards each other when they should become  
reconciled, despite my father's long-time addiction.

When after 10 months of national service I was "downgraded" and  
did not have to do the remaining 5 months.
When my mother caught me masturbating.

As the only person in my family into academics, I ought to have  
looked after my younger (and only) sister better, with respect to  
her education and life experiences.

When we were in high school a few guys sometimes provoked a  
friend of mine.  They called her a pig and then grunted.  This  
irritated most of the girls.  Once, one of the girls got angry at  
my friend and said something nasty and this made me terribly  
angry.
A mother who shouts at her child for nothing.

When I complained to my mother about how untidy the kitchen  
loooked, she boxed my ears ( this had never happened before).
When I had to leave my mother and my sister after a week's visit.
On the way down a ski slope which was difficult and steep.

When I was left alone one week-end without being prepared for  
it.
When I forgot about a meeting at work.

When my husband suddenly came to see me at my new job and  
brought some flowers and cake with him.
T.V features showing the violation of defenceless people.

When my husband talked about the restrictions he will have to  
accept in his life to make our marriage work.  I felt that it was  
directed at me as it was me who had demanded the changes.  We  
were with a marriage counsellor then.
Vertigo - standing on a ladder and painting the house.

When I argue with my mother about the way she treats her two  
children differently.

I was within a hair's breadth of knocking down a drunkard who  
suddenly ran into the street.  The fear came later when I      
realized what could have happened.

I was alone in a cottage I often stay in.  I was woken up by a  
rustling sound in the middle of the night.
When programmes on violence or pornography are shown on T.V.

When my half brother became seriously ill with cancer and died  
later.

I had promised to visit my girlfriend but for different reasons  
could not make it.  I rang up later to tell her that I could not  
come.

I had the window open and the door was shut so that the kitten  
would not go out.  My partner came in and started talking about  
something and I forgot about the window and suddenly I saw the  
kitten hanging from the window frame. I was rigid with fright  
till I got hold of her.

When I was a child it was found out that I had taken off my  
clothes outdoors.  It was summer and my friend and I were out  
in the woods.  It had felt exciting at that time.  My parents  
discovered that my trousers were back to front and I felt  
ashamed.

[ Cycling in the spring sunshine gives me such delight.   
Happiness is to be healthy, my wonderful finance.  Simply being  
here on earth.]

When my relationship with my family is very poor I often fear  
being excluded from the group, a fear which is stronger in  
situations when an argument is on hand.
When relatives have acted strangely, and unfriendly towards me.

When ,due to hunger and tiredness, I became generally irritated  
with my fiancee and made cutting remarks which really hurt him.   
Later I realized that my unfounded irritation had hurt the person  
I love most on earth.

On the way home from Marstrand I was driving behind my father's  
car.  Another car tried to push in front of my father and he was  
forced to swerve and he thus collided the car with a pillar.  The  
other car drove off without even seeing what had happened.

Last Summer I was walking along the beach in a bikini and an  
awful man came cycling after me.  He was shouting and I ran as  
fast as my legs could carry me.

I had some sort of a stomach virus last week and  I vomited in  
college in the morning, then in the cake shop, three times during  
the trip home and again when I got home.

Many years ago a friend wanted me to with her to southern Europe  
and I preferred to travel alone.  I felt guilty because I wanted  
to go on my own.
When I felt that my love was returned.

When I think now about the way my father behaved when filing a  
divorce.

Whenever I read or think about the way people treat animals and  
nature.
When my 6 month old son is happy and well.
When a colleague failed to contact me at the arranged time.

When I was an auxiliary nurse at the hospital and I had to change  
the nappies, for the first time, of a very old and sick woman.

When friends found out that I had been lying about where I had  
been on a particular occasion.

When I woke up one morning and went to the kitchen I discovered  
that our dog had diarrhoea.  There were small "piles" all over  
the floor and the smell was choking.

When I was young, about 6 or 7, I did not make it to the toilet  
on time.  I hid the dirty trousers in the cellar as I feared it 
being discovered by my parents.

When I gave birth to a child and saw that it was normal when it  
was put against my breast.

At a cash desk where I had gone to buy 16 rolls of kitchen paper  
at a reduced price.  After queuing with screaming children; it  
turned out that I had taken two 8 roll packets instead of the one  
16 roll packet to which the rebate applied.  The assistant said  
"You will have to get it another time."
When I first heard that Tage Dannielsson had died.

On the train a drunk person touched my baby and I reacted very  
disapprovingly.  I felt ashamed later as the person had not been  
aggressive though he could have been.

I was dominated by a certain person and even though I knew it I  
could not change my own reactions.

When I splashed a child by not slowing down while driving  
through a puddle of water.

A drummer who had borrowed my drums destroyed both the drumskin  
and the sticks.  He did not repair them nor did he tell me about  
it.

When I dived among sharks and the brightly coloured fish on the  
outer reef of Tvavni, Fidgi.

When I told off a computer teacher who did not want to teach me  
beacause of prejudice.
When I excreted on the mat instead of the potty.

When I pulled a chair from under someone at kindergarten and he  
hit his head.

When the car I was driving skidded on an icy road and landed in    
a ditch with one side against a rock.

I feel unbelievably happy about the relationship between my  
boyfriend and me, it is a reoccurring feeling.

When I argue with my boyfriend, I feel as though he feels  
superior to me.

When I failed an exam last Summer.  I had worked very hard for it  
and I was very disappointed thinking that it was hopeless to  
continue at college.  I did overreact.

When I have to leave the baby in the carriage and go shopping, I  
fear that something will happen to the baby.

When during Winter the water pipes froze and we did not have any  
water for two days.
The smell of garlic in rush-hour bus.

During the Christmas holidays, I met some of my old friends,  
after not having seen them for six months.

We were driving a car of a friend of mine when we turned in the  
wrong direction towards an unknown district, and nearly drove  
down a precipice.

I happened to see the video-tape movie "This is America - Part  
one" at my friend's place.

I insulted a couple of good friends of mine and even tried to hit  
them when I was drunk.  The next day, I was ashamed of course.

I was afraid of moving away from home and moving to Helsinki for  
my studies.
My father gave money to my brother but not to me.

I ate a Runeberg's cake, though I knew that I would immediately  
put on a kilo.
When my grandmother died. I had lived with her for ten years.

I had to decline an appointment which had been very important for  
the other person. For this reason we even got into trouble.

A person with whom I had been on bad terms, gave me a present. We  
became reconciled.

I had told a person unpleasant things in a bad manner. He was  
very depressed and caused an accident.

After having slept for a short time I woke up - I had the feeling  
of someone standing beside me and was very frightened. I had to  
turn on the light turn on the light for several minutes before I  
was able to get to sleep again.

It was in a tramway-carriage: A stranger insulted a girl just  
because she blew her nose. I detested his behaviour.

I came across a group of people with the same basic ideas/beliefs  
who were all fighting and going against what they would say was  
good.

I was working in a job in which I could not work quickly enough,  
and was told that my work was not up to standard.

I had wasted some time instead of doing something I needed to do  
to give to a friend. (Also in the time I wasted I had done some  
things I did not consider morally right).
On meeting an old friend of mine.
When my brother was very late in arriving home from work.
When I got a bad result for one of my assignments.

When I realised that I was forgiven by the God who is there, when  
I realised how much God loves me and that my acceptance with him  
is not based on my performance - that he loves me unconditionally  
and showed that love in Christ who died because I do need  
forgiveness.

I told my boy friend not to park in a certain place because the  
car would ger towed away - he didn't listen and it was towed away.  
At that stage, our finances were below the poverty line & it  
cost us $10.00 - all the money we had to get us through that week  
(including rent).

I "snapped" very abruptly at my mother when she said something  
silly and stupid, (in front of other people) she looked so  
defenceless & hurt & told them that I'm always doing that.

Watching an old lady running up the street to catch her bus and  
miss it, it reminded me of my own mother and how dreadful it  
would be to be her in the same situation.

When I saw all the starving people in Ethiopia on T.V.  It felt  
awful to see such suffering.

When a mistake occurred at work which I was not responsible for.   
This was disclosed later.
When I called my boyfriend he asked me if I would live with him.

Last Summer in Italy I was attacked by a dog.It was terrible to  
feel that untidy dirty dog against my naked skin.

When the guy I was in love with told me that he had met someone  
else and that we would not meet again for a year.  Although we  
did not have a steady relatioship, we were having an affair.
When my love for a guy was returned.

I was living at home during the Summer vacations and towards the  
end decided to take some of my clothes and other belongings to  
the appartment in Guttenburg.  When I had finished I went to my  
ex-boyfriend's (relationship uncertain) home and stayed there  
till 5 A.M.  I had to leave then as my parents needed the car for  
work in the morning.  My parents do not like my boyfriend.
When my ex-boyfriend and I separated.

I worked in a harbour and emptied latrine containers from the  
back of the lorries.
The day after the night I drank too much at a party.

When I was accepted as a student of Psychology here at  
Gutttenburg.

My father and I had an argument because I do not help enough at  
home.

I had intercourse with someone and then I realized that what I  
had done was wrong and it disgusted me.

When I was notified that I had been accepted as a Psychology  
student.

A lady I live with had not bothered to clean up before she went    
on holiday (I live in a collective).

I was present when they found a shop-keeper dead in his shop.   
He had been shot with a shotgun at close range.

[ I do not remember when I last felf ashamed.  I do not usually  
feel ashamed of what I do.]

My mother accused me of not visiting her enough when she was in  
hospital for an eye operation.

After I had made my debut at Ullevi against IFK, Gottenburg and  
got a good write up in the paper.

As an evening class teacher I got positive feedback.  When the  
atmosphere is good and a kind of relaxed understanding exists.
The sight of a man who ran amok (fighting) at a dance.

When a close friend met me at the station in the middle of the  
night, when I came back from a long and tiring journey.

When I understood that my marriage was falling apart, and we  
decided to be legally separated.
After my car accident, when I woke up in a heap of stones.
When I was admitted to a certain school as a student.

A drunken friend of mine was beating up another friend, who was  
also drunk.

I hit my little sisiter on the head with a stone while we were  
fighting.

My mother and her friends were speaking badly about my father  
when they were separated, and my brothers and sisters and myself  
were allowed to listen.
I was hunting, and was lost in the fog in the mountains.
When my girlfriend left me.
I failed to show up at an agreed date.
Meeting generally dominating persons in social occasions.
When my children were born.
When I was told that a good friend was seriously ill.

When I learned that a relative had been spreading rumours about  
me.

I was talking badly about a person to some friends, and  
discovered that his daughter was listening.

After having watched a crime show on the TV, I was about to take  
the dog for a walk. Then, suddenly, there was a man on the  
porch... (We live some distance away from other people).

A kitten had wandered into our office, and I was told to take it  
back across the street. When I crossed back, the kitten followed  
me and was run over and killed by a car.
When my term paper was evaluated.
Angry with my brother, who was making fun of me, teasing me.
I lost my way on a trip in the mountains.

Being subject to unfair treatment in a working group, someone  
"bending the rules" was protected by the boss. This resulted in  
more work for the others.
The death of a close friend.

Was confronted with a person having negative thoughts of other  
people because of their social status, beliefs, color and  
outlook on life (perspective).
I failed to complete a working task within the agreed time.

One of my best friends accused me of giving up to early on  
problems. It was only a casual remark on her side, but I was  
angry and hurt.
A friend which I hadn't seen for years, sent me a small present.
I was subject to false accusations, and got very angry.

This is difficult, since I don't remember feeling disgust towards  
anyone.
If I don't go to lectures, I often feel ashamed.

I was very angry with a girlfriend for interferring a little too  
much with my personal affairs. I told her so rather strongly and  
she started crying.
When my grandmother died.

When I secretly tried smoking for the first time, being 12 years  
old.
When the person that I was very fond of, returned to me.

When students in our working group showed no responsibility or  
interest in our work.

A close acquaintace cried for me. I felt happy because somebody  
cared.

A woman I know is slowly dying from cancer. Observing this  
process makes me sad.

My father died after two very painful weeks in bed. I felt  
relieved, and was ashamed of that.

We had a day off from school. Instead of helping my mother with  
her job, I stayed in bed all day.

Fearing the use of power or reprimands when I belong to the  
minority.

Political and military trnsgressions around the world, generally  
speaking. This cannot be described through this questionaire.

When my aunt took her own life, I felt guity for not  
understanding that she needed support.

When I tried to breake it up with my boyfriend, and he refused to  
let me go.
Can't remember having had this feeling.
Can't remember that feeling.

Going home alone through the forest after a girl guide (scout ?)  
meeting.
I get angry when people disbelieve me or misunderstand me.

Having passed the exam required to be an authorized Radio/TV  
dealer.
Succeeding in helping others.

I received the message that I'd been accepted at the school where I  
really wanted to go.

I came home and discovered that someone had broken in. Then I  
realized that they probably were still there.
Quarreling with my father, when he made false assertions.

I've always defended my sister when needed, at the expense of my  
brother. This has led to feelings of guilt towards him.
When colliding with my car. I myself was to blame.

My father was a member of the public Alcohol and Drugs Board,  
when I was picked up by the police for being drunk in a public  
place.

Receiving close friends form abroad, whom I hadn't seen for  
years.

Motorcycle accident with two people involved, running off the  
road. Broke an arm, only.
Can't remember any such feelings now.
Selling my used car.

The negative feelings towards me displayed by my  
"parents-in-law".
Reunion with my wife after a legal separation.

The house was on fire, and I was saved by the dog. I am afraid of  
the fire, verging on panic.
Relating to my closest family.

Thinking of the unknown, what happens at the moment of death,  
etc.

I feel disgust towards those who are responsible for the death of  
others.

Talking about a person's unattractiveness, not realizing that the  
person was listening.
Having gone to school without learning anything, as usual.
Overeating a traditional type of food - blood pudding.
Forgot to do some shopping that I had promised to do.
I crashed my father's car.
Being close to drowning.
Love problems.

Having finally to admit I was wrong, after having denied it for a  
long time.
I won the country ski championship.

Angry when our team (small boys) lost the county championship  
football final.

A teacher gave me lower grades than I was entitled to, and was  
hoping for.

Not helping parents enough at home and at the farm - this has  
happened many times.

Once I was stopped by the police in Spain, when I had some  
"grass" in my tobacco.

When a "friend" dropped a frog down my neck, and I didn't know  
what it was.
Fighting with my father while drunk.

I had a discussion with my wife about an over-weight acquaintance of  
our's, about her eating habits and the scars caused by her  
pregnancy.
[ I was thinking about death.]
A conflict with a pupil.
Selling the appartment after my divorce.
In the dark an unreal figure formed by a shadow.
[ When I was treated unfairly, regardless of my motives or deeds.]

I was coming home from an exam and I supposed that I had  
passed it so I ran to a restaurant for a beer.

My fiancee and I were at my parent's place watching TV. There  
were  only two TV-chairs and we were sitting on them when my  
drunken brother came in and rudely chased my fiancee off the  
chair she was sitting on.

We got into a fight with some chaps in front of our family house.  
The value of the property destroyed was approximately 15 000 FIM.  
I felt ashamed when my parents came to know about this.

I was on my way back from the Inter Rail, on board the ferry from  
Stockholm when my father called me at 7 o'clock to tell me that my  
uncle had died and that I would be seeing him off on his final  
journey within four days.

While in the army, I was treated unfairly by my superiors.  I was  
held responsible for a deed of which I was innocent.

When I lied to my girlfriend, telling her that I had passed an  
exam, when I actually did not even take it.

When I look at people around and know that people who are stupid  
look stupid.

When I saw Russian roulette on TV. (obviously the movie "Deer  
hunter")
[ Laziness makes one sad.]
When I shot a bird in the head with a shotgun.
[ Being close to another person.]
[ Uncertainty about my own abilities in an exam.]

Loneliness, being uncertain of myself in the Autumn.

Estrangement from my best woman friend.  We have been going

A lonely, neurotic, shy girl lives nearby. She has expressed a

Begining the week-end with my girlfriend : cozyness, beer and

 I sold my friend, I was despicable.

The death of a close relative.

When my favourite football team made a goal and was about to

Car accident in the middle of the night.

My mother's death.

A friend prepared a soup with chicken heads and invited me to eat

I had the unexpected possibility to see a friend I like very

At the hairdresser's, I got two stains of dyestuff on my new

Death of my grandmother.

I tried to pass an examination particularly well, but I did it

circumstances

One day, when riding on a bicycle path, a car coming from the

When I was ten years old a classmate laughed at me because I had

When my grandmother died - at her funeral.

At a discussion a friend took a "faschistic view", what I had not

After having left the company of someone who gave me a lot of

Feeling guilt after greed, buying chocolate and pigging out to

My feelings towards would-be in-laws for their participation in

No very strong such emotion. Treatment of my sister by her

I felt very sad when I had to give up something that by right was

When I was reproved eighth grade of high school.
The loss of the woman who loved me most till today.

On a telephone talk where I was agressive and stupid without the

When somebody suddenly said something (about me) at a wrong

Once I spoke without thinking very much - it was quite a

I came home from a party rather drunk. I said things I would

When I was on a cave excursion with friends, I suddenly lost them

When I had a Latin examination in school.

A friend was unpunctual, we wanted to prepare ourselves for an

When my grandparents moved to another part of the town.

When I attended school, our class visited an institution for

I had to take care of a neighbour's child. I did not look after

At a party I met a girl who drew me to her, told me some nonsense

Several days after my final examination at school, I was sitting

When we were playing, I hurt my little sister, but towards my

During a discussion I reacted very aggressively and so I made it

When I am discussing something with a person and I realize that

When we were on holidays my girl-friend had to leave me after 4

I felt a great joy when I knew that my father was going to sell  
the apartment from GUARUSA, because in some way we were helded by  
it, that means that we didn't go to any other place, because we  
had the apartment.

The day that there was a black-out in the city, and I was in an  
exposition, I felt fear that something more serious was  
happening, like a revolution for example.

I felt very sad when I saw the first list from the names of the  
people who entered at the University and my name wasn't there.

I felt disgust about all my friends. After having done a great  
effort to organize an evening together, and didn't work out, they  
put the blame on me. After this, I feel disgust towards those that  
blame me.

I feel ashamed every time that someone makes me a positive or  
negative critic.

When I discovered that I and my friend would be licensed at the  
first call. This emotion was accompanied by a great relief. It  
was the coronation of a year of sacrifice and extrene discipline.

When I didn't succeed to enter at the University, I felt that the  
college entrance course sistem prejudiced me, that my integrity,  
and effort weren't corresponded.
When I robbed a loop in supermarket.

A meeting with the family and the friends I felt dear and loved,  
sharing the gladness of being together at a birthday.
When I saw a horror film.

When I visited a creche. The conditions weren't too precarious  
but the children were in conditions of physical and emotional  
penury.
When I fell down.

When I realized that the person I was courting hadn't been really  
by my side for a long time already. He had deceived me and I let  
him deceive me.
When I noticed that I do many things to the pregiudice of myself.

I felt ashamed to be Brazilian and to live under a military  
dictatorship that despoiled the people, when during my military  
service.

I felt fear some months ago of losing the person whom I loved  
when she said to me that she didn't love me.

I felt much anger and perhaps I feel it till now, against my  
girlfriend's sister who incited her to betray me just when I  
needed her very much. She didn't think of anything, simply

I didn't like my former fob and felt joy when I received a  
telegram offering me a new one that I though better and for which

The day that my boyfriend appeared at home with a pair of rings  
for our wedding.

A ex-boyfriend tried to prejudice me before my fiancT and his  
family saying things about me that let his family worried. We had  
to postpone our wedding and we were already using our wedding

One day my boyfriend put my hand on his penis and I felt well,  
but after I felt a guilty conscience because I hadn't thought  
about the consequences that this could have brought if I had gone  
farther.
One of my pupils escaped from school to the street.
The birth of my daughter.

My daughter was a baby and was crying to be taken on my lap. I  
felt very nervous and moved her away and went out. As soon as the  
feeling of nervousness passed I was taken by an enormous feeling  
of guilt, for having rejected my daughter.

One of the greatest joiy was when I succeded in acquiring a  
motorcycle through my own efforts.

My main disgust is against codfish because I detest even the  
smell of it.
That someone would discover whom I really love.

When there was a fight at home and my father threatened to throw  
a chair on my brother.

After a disagreement between my parents, when I was alone with my  
father and my sister, the aggression continued, when my father

I was in the living room at home with an ex-boyfriend, it was  
nearly a year that we had separated, during the talk he began to

I was with a friend in a stationed car when, suddenly a man  
appeared on my side and an other with a gun on his side the

I was on a farm with a few friends and during the talk I  
discovered that a friend of mine, was being betrayed by her  
boyfriend and a 3rd friend of ours.

I was watching television. It was about midnight when a very dear  
friend called saying that his father had died in an accident.

When I left after the examination to enter the University, and  
even though I had studied the whole year I made a bad exam.

In a social situation I became interested in a woman. We talked,

A great friend of mine travelled with the intention to change his  
life. He didn't succeed and returned depressed. I had not power  
to support his frustration and his behavioral change.
When I whatched a horror film on a Friday 13th.
When I felt lack of aid from close friends.
Once, during a performance I did not sing the way I had to.
When I got separated from the woman I loved.
Once I promised to do something but I didn't do it.
I am afraid if I'll finish the term.
I was angry when my abilities of a singer were underestimated.
I have a new born child.
I could have been killed by a falling object.

I promised to fulfill an errand. Later I understood it was  
impracticable. The explanation I gave was accompanied by a sense  
of guilt.

Some days ago I fell down at a public place, I came into notice  
but thank God I was not mocked at. Though it hurt badly, at the  
first moment I felt shame, not ache.

I found a big black beetle in my coffee cup. It was alive big and  
it was moving its limbs.

I had thrown with the ashtray a still lighted cigarette in the  
plastic wastepaper basket. It had burnt out and my landlords made  
me a row that I might had set their flat on fire.

I was crossing the street together with some colleagues of mine  
when I suddenly found myself almost under the wheels of a truck.

An encounter with a man whom I love, after a very long  
separation.
I caught a glimpse of a black-beetle.
At a success of mine, at a real achievement.

I was disgusted with a friend's behaviour when she got absolutely  
drunk so that she vomitted all over my house.

protest loudly to some American sailors of the U.S. Texas  
submarine. A guy came up to me and said that's your brother  
screaming at, I felt shame and I realized screaming at another  
person isn't good protesting. Now I'm a silent protester.
When I hurt my parents in one way or another.
When I nearly caused a traffic accident with my car.

During a family reunion, they started talking about me wearing an  
ear-ring.

I felt dusgust with a self-iterested person who ruined the life

I stroke a person undeservedly.
I felt fear when my mother was heavily ill.

I felt anger against a colleague of mine during a rehearsal in

colleagues.

I felt it on the same occasion when I felt sadness which finally  
grew into anger.

to live in a three room flat together with two more families. The  
discords caused a change - one of the families moved out. The

in the struggle for this life because my fiancT did not stay next

commit suicide but instead I threw myself against the cause of  
the irritation.
When I quarrelled with my boyfriend.

I feel shy to show all my worth when I work for the first time  
with a conductor or a producer unfamiliar to me.

When I heard what mark I had got at the entrance examination and

When diving deep into the sea to reach the floor I felt

to the surface and inhale.

with high ranking officials.

When you are unjustly assessed at something you are sure to have  
been right.

For the loss of a close friend or relative, but you feel grief  
when you are away from home, too.
I couldn't be with a girl on whom I was very keen.

My first girlfriend. I had the feeling that she was going out  
with me only because of my defect.
Years ago I ran away from home which disappointed my parents.
Having passed an exam.
Having a car accident.

I'm glad when I have good relations with my colleagues and most  
of all when we are at a party.

I get angry with people who attain certain status without  
deserving it, only with the support, authority and influence of  
other people.

I am ashamed when I am not prepared in a subject and I have to  
answer in the presence of the patients.

I experienced it when I was accepted at the Medical Higher  
Institute.
When I do something unworthy.
After each successfully passed exam I am happy.
I am disgusted with liers, hypocrites, slanderers, flunkeys.

Recently I saw a young girl fawning on a man. And what for -  
money and things. I was ashamed to be a woman.

I have a friend that I deeply trusted but it happened that I lost  
my confidence in her for which she herself was to blame.

We are several friends but our characters are very different and  
we inevitably split in the two extremes. It is sad that I myself  
don't know what to do, I try not to hurt either of the "parties"  
because there are conflicts to which one I should belong.

In my 20s - and was going out to dinner to celebrate a friend's  
birthday. Her (older - in 30s) cousin, really wanted me to get  
drunk cos I'd visited their (cousin & wife) place quite a bit,  
but had always been very careful - brought up to believe in  
moderation in drink (but not guilt repression etc). I mixed  
drinking with smoking (which I rarely did) and got drunk and had  
to leave the table to get sick in the loo, and later went home  
and was sick again; have never felt so awful in my life. And I  
didn't want to face or tell my other flatmates, or family.

Teenage neighbours smashed my letterbox for the fifth time in a  
couple of months. It was a deliberate action of kids who had  
stayed in my home, had meals there yet took a dislike to my  
daughter.

Reported neighbour to police for taking to my daughter with  
baseball ball - her counsellor rang me and after long talk  
convinced me the woman was o.k. I felt guilty for ringing the  
police then guilty for feeling guilty about it.

Meeting with two of my friends I had not seen for 15 years. They  
were special people to me.

I was in the Korean War. We were attacked with mortars, me and  
companion. We stopped the jeep and ran for cover. Fortunately  
neither of us was hit but we both came close to being killed.

My son was apprehended for shoplifting at the age of 14. Because  
I too had been apprehended at the same age I felt the shame of  
not having been able to prevent my son from acting in the same  
way.

While tramping on a narrow path two of us were confronted by a  
woman with two snarling dogs, demanding we get off the property -  
via a flooded river !

A friend got angry and drove "like a lunatic" with me and others  
in his car. I was angry about his dangerous driving.

A boy I look after for the probation service deliberately  
offended to provoke a reaction from the police.

4-letter words on a TV programme (Roche) while we were  
entertaining "conservative" relations who wanted to see the first  
episode.

A young visitor to the house stole money from an elderly  
visitor's purse. It wasn't noticed for some hours.

In the house where I live there is a new flatmate. His friends  
unfortunately are the dirt of society, intelligent, fashonable,  
rich and bored. At a party recently they were doing things I  
didn't like done in my house. I felt angry at them.

When I was young I stole something from a shop and got caught,  
then I was taken to the police station and my parents had to come  
and get me.

When, for example, my grandfather fell seriously ill. It was  
necessary for him to be operated and I felt great fear of losing  
him because he is so dear to me.

When, for example, I left for the first time my parents and I  
went to live in Sofia.
When, for example, I fail in my undertakings.

Attitude to some manners of dealing and some "sanctioned"  
relations.

Exaggerating certain circumstances, wrong attitude and evaluation  
of these circumstances.
Getting separated from my girlfriend.
Encouter with a prostitute.
Before an examination.
Unjust punishment of a friend of mine.
I forgot to convey an important announcement.

When something unpleasant happens to a friend or relative of  
yours and you are at the bottom of it.

This feeling I sensed quite recently. It was arisen by the  
terrific thought that I might lose the man I loved !

Sometimes, when I'm alone I am seized by this feeling. But it  
always helps me to come round and at the same time to judge if it  
is worth. Very often this feeling is caused to me by people -  
friends who I love and respect.

I feel this feeling when I am to fill in a questionnaire or a  
form.
When the man I loved decided to leave me forever.
When I offend somebody unfairly.

One evening I was watching the news on TV. Again they were  
talking about the danger of war. Suddenly I imagined what it  
might mean for me, for my friends, for the people close to me. I  
felt it a very near and possible event.

Unfair and unjust attitude toward a person close to me, what I  
was the witness of, caused anger in me.

The thought that I'll never sit at the school desk again, caused  
a deep grief at the end of my eleventh form.

I had not punched a ticket in the bus because I had a card. But  
when the ticket-collector came it turned out that I had forgotten  
it. The shame I felt was great though it was not done on purpose.

At a moment of affect I offended a person very close to me. He  
had given me ground for that but it was a trifling in comparison  
with the way I insulted him. A moment later I felt a sense of  
guilt.
When I understood I was admitted to the Sofia University.

My son lives with my parents in the country and I feel this  
feeling always when leaving for Sofia, but the last time it was  
quite strong.

I am a sportwoman as well. I felt joy when after an year of  
practice, at a contest, I covered the norms for "a master of sports".

I felt fear once, when the car in which I travelled directed  
towards the precipice along the road.

When I had had the possibility to act or to do certain activity  
better but I had not done it because of reluctance or  
carelessness.
When my affairs with the girl I love settled positively.

I counterfeited a mark in the school register during the lesson  
in gymnastics. I felt this feeling two days later when I stood  
face to face with my teacher, whom I highly appreciated and  
respected.

In a fit of temper I told things that were unjust and they  
greatly hurt my mother though she didn't show it.

I was alone in my room at the boarding house when at 12 o'clock  
someone knocked violently on the door.

I felt sadness when I remembered my former boyfriend with whom I  
got separated an year ago and when comparing him with my present  
one with whom things are not much of a success.
Bulgaria won a football match against France.
I felt joy when my two twin sisters were born.

The night before my wife had given birth to our twins. I felt  
fear in the hospital yard, I feared if everything was going to be  
in order.

Some months ago my wife gave birth to twin sisters. She had no  
idea of looking after babies and she felt quite oppressed. The  
fact that I couldn't help her caused grief to me.

Some days ago I had a car accident. It was quite slight but  
through my fault. I felt strong shame because I had the spirits  
of a good driver.

A fear from the loss of a close friend as a result of his  
behavior.
When I don't succeed to fulfill a promise.

I felt joy when I saw my daughter after a separation of twenty  
days.
At a weakness on my part.
When I don't justify the confidence of people that I respect.
When I was admitted to the University.

Because of a conflict with my parents there was a possibility to  
interrupt my studies.

I was looking for an object when I came across a rotten corpse of  
a rat.
Before an exam in logics.

My husband and I were invited at the house of our nieghbours then  
we got an invitation on the part of my parents which we had to  
refuse. A a result they called me by words that provoked my  
anger.

My son lives in the country. I feel sadness when I see mothers  
having walks with their children.
A lie on the part of a person close to me.
I thought I had taken a decision but I hesitated.
I lost a close friend.

I was nailed. I lied in connection with a book which I took from  
the library, because I had to keep it for a longer time.

I didn't give back in time some money that I had borrowed. My  
friend relied on them.

When I feel I must be with somebody, to talk with somebody - but  
I am alone.

We had promised, with a friend of mine, to take our friends to a  
restaurant and after having looked for a place for hours without  
finding one, and not being helped by the others we had to give up  
the idea.

When I have to go in for an exam and the examinor is a person  
with a whimsical character and unsteady requirements.

I was totally unprepared for a seminar conducted by an assistant  
professor whom I highly respect.
When my dog was stolen.

I detest any kind of constraint and hate the attempts of elder  
people to force me to a norm of behavior without having legal or  
moral rights to do it. I felt this emotion when a neighbour of  
mine made me kick out my guests because they had talked very  
loudly and threatened that with "connections" she will expel me  
from the inst.

I experienced long ago when I was sightseeing Bulgarians in a  
foreign language.
When I met with friends that I hadn't seen for a long time.

I got angry with a stranger in a train who behaved impertinently  
and immorally

I became disgusted with the man on whom I had counted, who I had  
trusted, the man who should have been my mainstay - my father.  
I could hardly make myself (and the others) believe in this  
emotion. It has cumulated after events and deeds. Everything can  
happen in this world.

For the girl who halped me go on living and made me happy - when  
I don't see her even for two or three days.

I was embarassed at the exam in microbiology. I was ashamed with  
myself - how little I knew and how good was the examinor. I  
rarely become ashamed.

I got disgusted with a man who was beating a woman in the street.  
I just happened to be there but I was abhorred by the rudness.

I had an appointment with a colleague of mine to give her my  
lecture notes. I couldn't go and I didn't send them, and so the  
girl missed a day for the preparation of her term exams.

Two years ago I saw a film on the TV. Even now it makes me  
afraid.

The assistant professor saw me cheat at the preliminary  
examination.

I was very happy when I got the message that I had been accepted  
as a student in medicine.

My grandmother has been in a hospital for a week and I still  
haven't had time to see her.

When I learned that my parents were going abroad and leaving me  
alone for a few years.

Some time ago I was disgusted with the "cleanness" of the  
refectory of our institute.

I felt guilty last year during the winter term exams. A colleague  
of mine asked me to give him my lecture notes (I had very good  
notes and I had passed my exam in advance) but I still don't know  
why I didn't give them to him. That colleague failed and he was  
on the verge of not passing it at the supplementary examinations.

When I was admitted to the Institute. I had problems with many  
people about my applying for this institute and I decided to  
prove that one can pass excellently without visiting any  
preparatory couse. That is - I proved what I could do on my own.

I was at a children's camp abroad. The people (the leaders, my  
coevals) were very king to us. One night we smeared our foreign  
friends with tooth-paste while they were sleeping and then we  
roused the whole camp by our shouts. Later I was so sorry. I  
didn't utter a word for two days, then I went to apologize.

When I was in the fifth class the rating was done in our  
mark-books. I hadn't been examined yet but I had heard from my  
classmates about the scolding they had got at home. My first  
mark was in geography - good 4. I judged I had known for more  
than that and I put down "very good" for fear of being scolded.  
Naturally my parents guessed all about it. They rebuked me for  
what I had done.

My grandmother's brother had taken active part in the resistance  
movement. He had been in prison many times and there he lost his  
health. He became an invalid. When we phoned to First Aid the  
nurse on duty behaved quite unkindly when she understood how old  
he was (79).

I suffered from a gynaecological illness. I was quite displeased  
to hear that my roommates had talked about it and they had  
misrepresented the truth. I felt deeply hurt when I learned that  
it was done by a "good" acquaintance of mine.

I felt glad when I took the rather difficult organic chemistry  
examination.

The sense of guilt came over me too, when I interrupted my  
studies. Why ? Because I felt guilty before my parents ! They  
believed in me though this event did not make them disbelieve me.

I sensed a strong feeling of joy when in the plant, at my working  
place, I got a message that I was admitted as full time student at  
the Higher Agricultural Institute.

Fear when fulfilling my obligations on my first night fatigue  
duty as a soldier.
The loss of a close relative who was ill with cancer.

Some time ago I promised to meet an acquaintance of mine and to  
carry him some promised papers. I haven't done it until this day.  
Now I feel quite awkward when I meet him.

When you are far away from relatives and friends. I feel sad for  
my early years, for the freedom and the carefree years of  
childhood.

I didn't visit a very close friend at the hospital and some days  
later he died.
When I quarrelled with a very close friend of mine.

When I wasn't well prepared for a terminal exam and the teacher  
tried to give me a three by asking me some very easy questions. I  
burned with shame then.

It was not long ago when I and two of friends of mine got quite drunk  
and one of them began to rave under the influence of the alcohol.  
I felt fear of what could have happened.

Immediately after the New Year holidays I happened to visit a  
party where there was a lot of alcohol and I became drunk. On the  
next day I felt sort of ashamed when I remembered what I had said  
and done on the night before.
When I was admitted to the Higher Institute.

I feel fear quite often but this feeling was very strong last  
year when my husband was quite unexpectedly sent to the hospital.

I felt sad when a friend of mine died and I felt that something  
had irrevocably gone away from me.

I felt disgust with a lady teacher who used to nag, to mock, to  
interrupt everyone of my fellow students each time we had a class  
with her in our first year.

That was what I felt when I told my first lie and then was  
cought.

I was for the first time on a brigade this year. At that time my  
sister was to bear a child. I was mad with joy when I opened the  
telegram from my parents and learned I had a nephew.

It was some years ago when one evening some people came home and  
told us my father was badly injured in an accident.

I faced this feeling when I realized I wasn't admitted to the  
institute in the first classifying, in spite of the high mark I  
had got at the entrance examination.

I took part in a football match. The referee was extremely  
partial to the opposite team. This stirred up my discontent and  
anger.

During a summer holiday at a bar I happened to see a dead to the  
world woman.

When for the first and the last time I tried to crib and the  
teacher was with her back to me but right when I was taking the  
materials out she turned round and saw me.

Disgust for a person who treated me badly, and has treated other  
people similarly - including lying, hiding facts, being  
deceitful, unfair, etc.

Losing my temper and allowing myself to act childishly by yelling  
and screaming at a person who I felt had done me wrong - in  
effect lowering myself to their level.

When I had lied to a friend/son about some things we had  
discussed and I had to be one better.

In a sociology class I felt very angry towards some members of  
society for exploiting the Polynesian people, dawn raids by  
Police (Martin Luther King, Blacks in S.A.). But this was just a  
reflection of my own shortcomings.

When I meet old past pupils of mine - and find they are all doing  
well - I feel joy. Yesterday I met a young woman (20 yrs) I'd  
taught her at 6 yrs, then at 12 yrs and hadn't seen her for last  
3-4 yrs; she was no longer a waitress but a meter maid for  
Council.

My dog of 16 and 1/2 years - "Lord Grey" died in his sleep - His  
death caused me more and deeper sadness than I thought.

I told Mr Winter of Downtown Fashion to go to - when he did not  
accept my Visa !
When I accepted a lunch invitation from a past male friend.

When my husband got picked up in our new car for drunken driving.  
We had made a pact the other would not drink and so therefore  
would be the driver for the evening etc. I was not present at the  
time.

My partner without discussing with me the situation decided it  
was time for us to have a break and went ahead and arranged his  
own life for the next 6-12 months, then told me the day before it  
was about to happen having been tolerant and friendly for the  
preceding week.

I had been living in an overseas city and made the decision to  
leave the city and come home about 12 months before I met a whole  
new set of friends, leaving them at the airport was sad and  
traumatic as they had helped me in many ways and I knew I  
wouldn't see many of them again.

After I had managed to fail my first year at University I was  
scared as to what I was going to do with my future. I didn't want  
a mundane 9-5 job and yet I didn't know if I could pay my way  
through an unsubsidized year at university to settle down and  
continue my studies.

Like guilt - the most ashamed I have ever felt was when I began  
to feel guilty about having sex with my boyfriend when it was  
only "the thing to do", and not really an act of love.

My mother along with some of my friends gave me a surprise  
birthday party - they invited a large number of my friends along  
too.

My mother did not come home till late at night (Ages ago). Anyway  
if I don't know where my parents are and when they'll be back I  
start thinking that perhaps they have had an accident and are  
perhaps dead.

Because I am the Captain of a basketball team I usually organise  
a roster system so that everyone in the team can have a turn at  
doing either a duty or a ref. A lot of the time the girls can't  
be bothered or just forget - I usually have to fill in.

When I was in a car with my parents and friends and we had to  
back up (reverse) pass a river which when I recall it (I was only  
about 5 yrs) seemed we were going to fall in and drown.

My brother gave me a beating because he could not beat me  
verbally.

Joy for me is when all my family gather around home for special  
occasions as Christmas etc. It really gives me joy to see my  
family and relatives and to observe natures productivity process  
which have been going on for centuries.
Never really had the experience just yet - N/A.
Had fear of losing husband.

That if ever I was really naughty I would be sent away from my  
Mum and Dad to another family. I was fostered from age 5 and  
didn't get to Mum and Dad until I was 6 and then legally adopted  
at 14.

A child told me she had been sexually abused by her step-father.  
I only knew the child and had not come into contact with either  
parent. I tried to do what was best for the child. The event and  
the stepfather disgusted me.

I lied to my mother in the sixth form she said she would ring to  
find out and I had to tell her I had lied.
Joy at meeting a woman I love very much.
When I masturbated in my room.

When I betrayed my lover, she told me something in confidence, I  
felt at the time I had to relay the information back to the  
person concerned, as I felt the situation volitile, did this  
without telling my lover, she felt like piggy in the middle, as  
she was not directly concerned. Maybe you could call it gossip I  
felt different after I had slept on it. If I had waited, thought,  
NOW I would not have done it.

Sitting in a bus, I heard behind, the voice of a girl I was  
friendly with. After her talking for some time with another girl  
I decided it wasn't her in fact that someone miming her, which it  
was when I finally looked. I was talking to a friend at the time.

I felt that I contributed to a possible rift in the relationship  
between a boy and girl soon to be married, in my flat after I  
moved in. After stating my celibacy to him which she overheard  
and didn't previously know about I suspect.

Being sexually assaulted (not rape, but passionate kissing) by a

felt disgusted and beat me up.  I felt very sad as my father had  
never beaten me or scolded me before.

My boyfriend and I did not have any contact with each other during   
the Summer holidays.  I met him the day of the registration and looked   
through him.  In the canteen he asked me if I wanted to have a drink and   
I said no as I did not want him to do me a favour.

I was on a trip to Phillipines during Summer and I was staying in  
a hotel.  The room I was staying in was very silent and had very  
dim lights.  The last night I felt frightened and lay awake - I  
could hear some sounds around me and dared not open my eyes - I  
waited for dawn.

I had a very good friend in secondary school.  The year after our  
graduation I prepared to celebrate her birthday and I called off  
all my appointments.  I got together the other friends and we  
were ready to give the entire day to her.  However this friend  
disappeared on her birthday.  When I phoned another friend I  
didcovered thay she was busy, I did not call her anymore.

My academic result was poor and I had to repeat the second year.   
I felt sad about the coming several years.

My mother was always fastidious about my room, bed time, etc.   
She treated us strictly and punished us physically.   These  
things were intolerable.

When I was in P3 I was always punished as I would forget to do my  
homework.  The first time that I was punished and not allowed to  
leave school, I slipped out of school.
When my behaviour was immoral - thinking about sex.

I borrowed my classmate's notebook one week before the  
examination and I promised to give it back to her in two days  
time.  I was very busy at that time and forgot many things; as I  
was not very often at home she could not contact me.  When I  
started my revision I realized that her notebook had been on my  
desk for five days.  I contacted her immediately and gave it back  
to her.  Though she did not say anything I felt very guilty.

When high level results were declared, I found my candidature  
number.  I was very happy as I had not expected it.  As I had been   
injured before the examination and I had performed poorly.

When I got into a bus I found that my wallet had been stolen.  
It was not a great loss from the monetary point of view but I  
lost some documents - identity papers.  As a result I had to  
spend several days in order to get a new one.  I will always  
remember all the work I had to do and the bad treatment I  
suffered because of the bureaucratic behaviour of the civil  
servant.  I had already had bad luck and they treated me like a  
criminal.   At one point of time I really wanted to quarrel with  
them.

I quarrelled with my younger sister because I had said something  
against her boyfriend.  Consequently she looked through me when  
she saw me as she thought that I was trying to separate them.   
She had misunderstood me.

After attending a song contest proposed by a band called "Chyne"  
we (6 of us) waited for the members of the band to greet us in  
front of the stage.  We went out after a few minutes as it was  
time to close the hall.  We had been waiting at the entrance hall  
for ten minutes when three of the band members came out.  They  
were very excited to see us, one of them was so excited that he  
had tears in his eyes.  We felt very warm and close to each  
other.  They took us back into the hall and we talked freely.  We  
were together for about an hour and during this time we felt  
that they were very sincere.

When I was in lower six I joined an interview group to  
interview the general public.  One of my friends in the group  
lost her purse and she was very nervous.  Five of us had to go  
another place so we left her, and planned to see her later.  Then  
I heard her describing how her purse looked.  I realized that I  
had seen her purse on the floor and had not wanted to do any  
thing about it.

Last week I had planned to play tennis and had booked a tennis  
court.   However when I arrived at the university gym the clerk  
told me that the court was being used for lessons.

A few days back I was waiting for the bus at the bus stop.   
Before getting into the bus I had prepared the exact amount of  
coins to pay for the bus fair and when I got into the bus I put  
these coins into the box meant to collect the bus fair.  I  
thought that I had paid and wanted to get inside.  However the  
bus driver called me and asked me in an impolite way if the coins  
were stuck at the opening  of the box.  He had not seen me paying  
and there wasn't a stack of coins in the box.  I could not  
understand this and the driver kept questioning me.  He made me  
feel angry and at last i inserted a dollar coin in the box just  
to get away from him.  Later I found that I had forgotten a few  
coins in my pocket and had not paid enough for the fair the first  
time.  After I had entered the bus I could still hear him  
scolding me and I felt disgusted.

A few days back I had a tutorial class and the teacher randomly  
assigned one person in each group to make a presentation.  The  
discussion in our group had been confused and the presentation  
was not very well prepared.  Unfortunately I was selected to  
present and I could not keep calm, was confused and result was  
very poor.  I really felt ashamed.

After seeing a horror film - Omen.  I could not sleep at night   
even though I closed my eyes.  The last scene of the film kept  
coming back to me, I seemed to hear the girls in the film  
shouting at the devil.  The devil did not have any expression on  
his face and I thought that he would choose me.

My friend often played a joke on me and sometimes I thought that  
he was a nonsensical person. Once when we went to a friend's  
house he walked in first and shut the door firmly behind him.  I  
felt that he did not respect me and moreover I was his friend so  
he should not have behaved like that.  I was very angry (as it is  
I was in a bad mood then).

I wanted to get rid of a bad habit and it seemed that I had  
succeeded.  However a year later I got the bad habit again.  I felt   
useless as I always found excuses to explain my behaviour.  As a result I  
felt guilty.

During the exam period I studied in the library alone.  A close    
friend of mine, who is also a classmate, told me that my  
application for a Japanese inter-cultural exchange programme had  
been accepted.  I was not very sure as I did not know that the  
list had been declared.  I ran to the board and saw that I was  
really included in the list.  I was so excited that I smiled all  
day long.  When I met my classmates and friends I told them the  
good news.  I was so happy that I could not concentrate on my  
studies.

We had fixed time for practice as we had to participate in the  
inter-department song contest.  I arrived and found that there  
was nobody there.  When I went to the canteen I found them eating  
lunch.  I was so angry that I aired my greviances to one of them  
and then left.

A friend told me that he had suffered in love and in academics.   
I shared his sadness.

A friend told me that a boy wanted to get to know me.  At that  
time I felt disgusted and thought that it was a nonsense thing.

One rainy day when the streets were wet, and as I was walking down  
a slope, I fell down out of my carelessness.  There were many  
people and they saw me, so I felt ashamesd.  Moreover I hurt my  
ankle and it was painful.

My friend and I worked for the community centre by holding a booth.  
 One day my friend went off to another booth to play.  This  
meant that I was very busy and could not maintain order.  His  
behaviour disgusted me.

When I was in a bus on my way to the examination centre, a man     
sitting opposite me kept looking at me continously.  I did not know   
what was wrong.  When I reached the  centre I started strolling around   
as I still had a little time.  Suddenly a man came and whispered "You   
have forgotten to zip up your trousers."  I was at a loss to say anything   
and I felt very embarrassed.  When I thought of the bus incident I felt   
even more ashamed.

One night, my boyfriend expressed his love for me in the canteen in  
the presence of my friends by giving me a present.

After listening to ghost stories with my classmates I had to back  
alone to the hostel at night.  I had to walk through a long and  
quiet road and I was scared of meeting a ghost.

When I asked my classmate to teach me to do my homework, he asked  
me to study by myself first but I did not do it.  When he asked me  
 if I had studied, I felt very ashamed.

I escaped from communicating with God for a long time.  I did not  
read the scriptures and I did not pray.  I felt that I was  
getting further and further away from God.  I felt guilty as this  
was because of my laziness.

When two female classmates and I were having lunch, we chatted and   
cracked jokes, I was very happy.  However, I felt that I may have   
said something inappropriate which might cause them to have a bad   
impression of me.

Once while playing tennis with my classmate I lost a few tennis  
balls.  I found one near the tennis court and took it to be mine  
despite thinking that it might belong to the student in the next  
court.  I felt guilty.  Later someone came to me to claim the  
ball and I gave it back to him.

When I received a letter from the university telling me that my  
application had been accepted.

At primary school the teacher caught me cheating during a  
dictation.
I forgot to zip up my trousers, this was not noticed by anyone.

There were old people in a crowded bus and I did not have the  
courage to give them my seat.  I closed my eyes to sleep and then  
opened my book to read.  In my heart I wanted to give them the  
seat.

In the past I used to think that my mother was a very nagging  
person.  When I started living at the hostel we had little time  
to meet each other.  Whenever I went home she would take care  
of me.  I gradually realized that what she had done was for my  
own good.  So very time I saw her I felt guilty.

This issue worried me rather than saddening me.  In mid September  
I went to Guanggho alone.  I was looking for an accomodation in  
the evening and after having walked 2 or 3 miles I still could not  
find anything.  What could I do?  I was not worried about  
sleeping on the streets but because of some procedural problems.   
I finally found a place to sleep at 8 o'clock.

My roommate liked to listen to some meaningless songs which had  
melody but had no content.  We lived together so when he played  
the recorder I was forced to listen to them.  I could not tell  
him that I did not like to listen to the songs, as I had no right  
to disturb the freedom of others.  So I would find a pretext to  
leave the room and go somewhere else.
I lied to one of my best friends.

I had shouted at my younger brother and he was always afraid when  
I called out loudly.
